name: Frp
author: Matheusn.biolowons@gmail.com
description:
üíé Egg: Frp
‚öôÔ∏è Version: 2.2
‚ùì What is it: A fast reverse proxy to help you expose a local server behind a NAT or firewall to the Internet.
üêû Bugs fixed/changelogs:
‚Ä¢ Now the Egg is not dependent on updates, everything is done by scripts, which results in better maintenance.
‚Ä¢ The code is now cleaner.
‚Ä¢ New Variables: 
   ‚Ä¢ Frps or Frpc?
   ‚Ä¢ Install Example?
‚Ä¢  2.1: Update to the new FRP system (.toml)
‚Ä¢  2.2: Docker changed from ubuntu/debian to alpine (lighter)
‚ö†Ô∏è Attention:
‚ùóÔ∏èThis Egg requires at least 4 ports (go to startup in the panel, and specify the ports, it's complicated to handle, just tag me if you need help.)
üìñ Windows will detect Frp as a virus due to Port Tunneling.
üö´If you already have this Egg installed on a server, a reinstallation will be necessary (Make a backup of your files first.)
üëë Author: Ashu
üëÄ Check for updates: https://github.com/Ashu11-A/Ashu_eggs

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Ashu11-A/Ashu_eggs/main/Connect/all/Frp/start.sh -o start.sh
chmod a+x ./start.sh
./start.sh

variables.name: Version
variables.description:
Version that will be installed when the egg is installed.

Ex: v0.44.0 (latest will always install the most recent one)

variables.name: Bind Port
variables.description: Modify and set the port to connect to Frp clients.

variables.name: Dashboard Port
variables.description:
Dashboard
Check Frp's status and proxy statistical information via the Dashboard.

Set a port for the dashboard to enable this feature:

variables.name: Dashboard User
variables.description: Username to use for the Dashboard.

variables.name: Token
variables.description: Token to access Frp, this is necessary as a security measure.

variables.name: Frps or Frpc
variables.description: Choose how Frp will behave. The default is Frps. OFF = Frpc (server B on LAN with private IP) ON = Frps (server A with public IP).

variables.name: Install Example?
variables.description: This will install a Windows 64bit example. If you want a different architecture, consult: https://github.com/fatedier/frp/releases
